reviewText: The characters feel right...the way that you would expect them to be from reading the comic books.  I suppose it would have been more interesting, if the characterizations went a little deeper than their well-defined roles, but, hey, it's an animated adventure.  Also, there is a lot of recurrence of the same villains across all of the these Fantastic Four volumes.  My only real complaint, though, is that I am not a fan of this type of art, which makes all of the characters' chins pointy.  What's the point of that, anyway?
A different twist from the 90s I grew up watching.
Didn't realize that this volume had episodes I already had in Vol. 1. But that was my error. Otherwise it was fine.

Super Heroes? Fantastic heroes is more like it. This Dvd set is full of FF episodes that you can watch if you have a dvd player. Don't try to put a dvd in a vcr though because it won't work. However, you do not need a dvd player or a vcr to look at the pictures on the dvd cover.
Awesome!
I've been a fan for over 30 years, these videos are a lot of fun!!

The Volume 3 is good. In some parts, Jhonny's flames are not so good. They made too much transformation on Ben's costume. My favorite episode is with Ironman.

Stan
